node.title: Kitten season sees lots of unwanted pregnancies
node.description: A call from a vet clinic led to Nerida taking in three small kittens found in park bushes. There was no sign of mum anywhere and had heard crying for a number of days. The kittens were very skinny, anaemic, and weighed only 200-250 grams.
node.content:
["The day before Halloween last year, Nerida Atkin received a familiar phone call.", "Three tiny kittens had been handed in at a local vet \u2014 they had been found abandoned by their mother, crying in some bushes in a Sydney\u00a0park.", "Atkin has been working with sick and injured animals for more than 20 years. Using her skills as a\u00a0veterinary\u00a0nurse, she has spent the past 16 years fostering stray and homeless kittens through the Cat Protection Society of NSW.", "Her charges this time were the length of healthy six-week-old kittens, but instead of weighing the usual 600 grams, they were severely malnourished at just 200 to 250 grams.", "\"Me being a huge Nightmare Before Christmas fan, I named them Lock, Shock and Barrel,\" Atkin says.", "\"They were in such poor condition the vets were unsure if they would make it through the night but wanted them to have a fighting chance.\"", "\"The kittens were very skinny, covered in fleas which were making them anaemic, and had severe cat flu which meant they couldn't breathe properly, causing nasal and eye discharge.\"", "", "
Three tiny kittens were surrendered to the vet. They had been found abandoned by their mother, crying in some bushes in the park.(Supplied: Nerida Atkin)
", "Atkin bathed them\u00a0to remove all the fleas and immediately set about treating their flu. After a touch-and-go night, they were still fighting in the morning.", "Each year the RSPCA receive orphaned newborn kittens, many of which staff and foster carers are able to provide intensive 24-hour care and bottle feeding, according RSPCA NSW chief veterinarian\u00a0Liz Arnott.", "\"Very young or weak motherless kittens require experienced, dedicated neonatal foster carers to safeguard their welfare,\" she says,", "\"Approximately 3 per cent of our feline intake last year were these vulnerable kittens that were unviable in part because there were insufficient carers to provide this skilled, intensive care.", "\u00a0\"We could not do this work without the generosity of donors, but our resources are always stretched at this time. More donations are critical to us continuing and expanding our work.\"", "
RSPCA animal intake increases
", "Dr Arnott has spent more than a decade working in regional NSW as a small animal practitioner and has has seen her fair share of cat pregnancies.", "\"As temperature and day length increase, cat breeding activity increases. From November to March most years is our busiest time with cats and kittens. The numbers of cats and kittens the RSPCA have to care for skyrockets by around 400 per cent,\" she says.", "", "
Dr Liz Arnott has spent more than a decade working in regional NSW as a small animal practitioner.(Supplied)
", "And as the weather warms up, shelters across NSW are filled with homeless litters. During breeding season, shelters receive between 500 and 600 cats each week.", "A third of cats and kittens surrendered to RSPCA NSW are by owners who are not able to cope with the extra mouths to feed. A whopping 80 per cent of cats who end up at the RSPCA have no means of being reunited with their original owners. Additionally, only three in every 100 are returned to their original home.", "When cats are \"on heat\", they tend to exhibit displays such as humping, scent marking, aggression, excessive howling and discharge. Kittens can fall pregnant as early as four months old, and in just two years, a single pair of undesexed cats could result in up to 20,000 kittens.", "", "
One of the Hunter shelter kittens looking for their forever home.(Supplied)
", "This is often because\u00a0owners do not desex\u00a0their cats or let them roam freely outside.", "Research shows that desexed animals live longer, are less likely to get certain illnesses and experience a reduction in behaviour problems like roaming, aggression and urine marking. Contained cats are less likely to become lost if they have been microchipped.", "
A happy ending\u00a0
", "It was good news for Nerida Atkins'\u00a0charges.", "For two weeks they were fed by eye dropper \u2014 and later by bottle \u2014\u00a0with kitten formula every four to six hours as well as given medications to help them recover.", "", "
Shock was surrendered to the vet along with her brothers.\u00a0They had been found abandoned by their mother, crying in some bushes in the park.(Supplied:\u00a0Nerida Atkin)
", "They slowly started looking for food, lapping and suckling at kitten food in a bowl.", "\"They started playing and grooming each other, acting like kittens\u2026", "\"It took us two months to get them to full health and to a healthy weight of one kilogram. They then were desexed and found their forever homes within two days of being up for adoption.\""]
